page.title: 02West Lethans Farm
page.content: West Lethans Farm lies half a mile East of Knockhill Racing Circuit. The landscape is rough grazing and some seeded grass. West Lethans Farm consists of about 400 acres of rough grazing. The farm grazes 400 blackfaced ewes and at the lambing time they produce on average 560 lambs. The area of rough pasture is approximately 250 acres. The other 150 acres have been improved at one time. The farm consists of seven large, fenced in fields and a rough grazing hill. In the winter the farm has 80 cattle which are mainly Ling cows. 40 of the cows and their calves go away to grazing in the summer. The farm is run by one sheperd with help from five dogs.
